intro: Mesembryanthemum ausanum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and coastal environments, adapting well to sandy soils and full sun exposure. Mesembryanthemum ausanum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and drought-resistant nature.
